info.name: KADA Connect Backend API
info.description:
Comprehensive API collection for KADA Connect Backend with all endpoints

## Authentication Flow
1. Register: `POST /api/auth/register`
2. Login: `POST /api/auth/login` (receives access_token, refresh_token)
3. Use token: `Bearer {{accessToken}}`
4. Refresh: Automatic via Supabase
5. Logout: `POST /api/auth/logout`
6. Forgot Password: `POST /api/auth/forgot-password`
7. Reset Password: `POST /api/auth/reset-password`

## Password Reset Flow
1. User requests reset: `POST /api/auth/forgot-password` with email
2. User receives email with reset link
3. Link redirects to frontend: `http://localhost:3000/#access_token=...&refresh_token=...&type=recovery`
4. User submits new password: `POST /api/auth/reset-password` with access_token and new password
5. Password is updated, user redirected to login

## Environment Variables
- `baseUrl`: API base URL (default: http://localhost:3001/api)
- `accessToken`: Bearer token from login
- `refreshToken`: Refresh token from login
- `testEmail`: Test user email
- `testPassword`: Test user password
- `adminKey`: Admin key for admin endpoints
- `studentId`: Student ID for testing
- `companyId`: Company ID for testing
- `userId`: Current user ID
- `resetAccessToken`: Access token from password reset email (for testing)
- `rateTestEmail`: Email for rate limit testing

## Rate Limits
- Login: 5 attempts per 15 minutes
- Logout: 10 attempts per 15 minutes
- Registration: 10 attempts per 15 minutes
- Forgot Password: 3 requests per hour per IP

## Version
1.2.0 - Fixed Password Reset to use access_token (Implicit Flow)
